data.title: Implement Graphics.Effect.EffectParameter.GetValueMatrix()
data.body: I needed to implement GetValueMatrix() for a project so I'm adding my minor work as a pull request.

data.title: DrawInstancePrimitives not implemented
data.body: See issue 1229. DrawInstancePrimitives is not implemented. Need some research on how this may be supported on other platforms. @tomspilman may know how to do this in DX.

data.title: Missing Dark Background Graphics Support
data.body: There should also be a version of the logo art that supports a dark background. The logotype should be white instead of black in this case, and the blending mode should be transparent.

data.title: Missing Transparent Graphics/Logos
data.body: Need a set of logo art that supports a transparent blending mode. Current artwork only has a white opaque background.

data.title: More MGCB Improvements
data.body:
Even more improvements to the MonoGame content builder:
- /outputDir and /intermediateDir are no longer required.
- Better command line usage docs.
- Improved logging to show exceptions and skipped files.
- We now throw an exception if the importer doesn't match the processor.
- Fixed PipelineException constructors.
- We no longer clear processor parameters on /build.

Still need to finish fixing /clean and add /incremental.

data.title: Fixed wp8 touch bug
data.body:
Fixed the wp8 touch bug:
http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/431035

data.title: [WindowsDX] Major Issue: Unknown stretching/resizing of sprites.
data.body:
When I set the sprite render count to 20000 the result looks like this.
http://www.xanather.com/problem.png

When I set the sprite render count to 10000 the result looks like this (like it should):
http://www.xanather.com/noproblem.png

Test subject:
http://www.xanather.com/MonoGameTest.zip

Only WindowsDX has this problem WindowsGL does not.

data.title: Re-target ThirdParty/Libs to include latest NAudio.
ContentBuilder - Added Configurations for Linux and Mac
data.body:
Added configurations for the solution to allow easy testing on linux and mac
Fixed a few compiler errors for mono
Added a few #if WINDOWS in the AudioContent.cs as the MediaFoundationResampler and MediaFoundationEncoder seems to be unavailable even with the latest ThirdParty libs

data.title: The MGFX file is corrupt!
data.body:
I tried to use the default XNA gamestudio effect file
1. Created a Monogame Content Project in visual studio 2010
2. Set the sulution configuration to Windows 8
3. Added a default effect, with add -> new item -> effect file
4. Selected properties

Build action                       Compile
Copy to Output Directory    Copy always
1. Build the solution
2. Copy the resulting Effect.xnb file to the Content directory of my Monogame test project (http://www.riemers.net/eng/Tutorials/XNA/Csharp/Series3/Starting_point.php)
3. Selected properties

Build action                       Content
Copy to Output Directory    Copy always

8 Run the Monogame test project 

But i always get the same error "The MGFX file is corrupt!"

Am i missing something?

Greetings,
Fuzzball

data.title: Writing WMA and AAC/MP4 song files
data.body:
With NAudio 1.7-alpha03 and MediaFoundation support, we can now write WMA and AAC/MP4 encoded files.

Requires https://github.com/kungfubanana/MonoGame-Dependencies/pull/22
Once that is merged, I will add the submodule update to this PR.

data.title: MGCB Improvements
data.body:
A bunch of improvements to the MonoGame Content Builder.
- Removed .contentproj support.
- Refactor of command line parser.
- Support for "response files".
- Preliminary support for cleaning output and intermediate directories.
- Fixes to PixelBitmapContent where it was using height instead of width.

I also put up some [preliminary documentation](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/wiki/MonoGame-Content-Builder) for using MGCB.

data.title: Add support for Keys.RightControl/Keys.RightShift
data.body:
Right now keyboard depends on CoreWindow.KeyUp/KeyDown events.
 The problem is that those events does not distinguish between
 LeftControl/RightControl (same for Shift,etc) but report a generic
 VirtualKey.Control.

In that case i check against CoreWindow.GetKeyState(...) and the _keys
 array to update the state of such keys.

data.title: ISSUE 1149
data.body: yet another attempt at pulling in this set of graphics changes. FTR: git wanted to pull in a bunch of files (but not all) to normalize their line endings. could be some files inthe repo have inconsistent line endings? someone might want to do a blast on the line endings some night..

data.title: GraphicsDevice.cs DrawIndexedPrimitives throws NotImplementedException when minVertexIndex > 0
[ContentPipeline] PCM->PCM sound effect processing and writing
data.body: ADPCM doesn't work yet, and will most likely require the NAudio 1.7 library with MediaFoundation support.

data.title: EnvironmentMapEffect, RenderTargetCube
data.body:
I am currently porting one of my games from WP7 to Windows 8. My game uses a lot of EnvironmentMapEffect instances and the used cube maps are generated by using a RenderTargetCube. Unfortunately it seems none of this is supported with monogame.

First, there is no RenderTargetCube at all. I've seen that there is no RenderTargetCube at all, are there any plans to implement this class?

Second, I've tried a simple workaround by simply loading the cubemap from a file. Also this does not work (null pointer is thrown as the cubemap is null). Is that feature currently supported or not`?

Thx!

data.title: FIX: Using several BlendModes in PSVita
data.body: This PR fix a issue when the game use several SpriteBatchs with different BlendModes in PSVita.

data.title: Lots of things broken in 1/24/2013 develop3d pull
data.body:
In MonoGame.Framework.Windows project:
- Conditional defines changed underlying API from OpenGL to DirectX
- Project is completely missing the OpenTK reference (which makes sense if you want to use DX - I don't)
- Missing DLL for GamePad operations
- Sound class referenced in SoundEffect.cs is not defined anywhere

etc.

Also posted in the forums:

http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/430793

HEAD~3 doesn't have any of these problems.

Anyone interested in getting CI set up? 

http://www.circleci.com/

Plugs straight into github. They recently added Mono support, and are looking at adding OSX testing (though licensing issues makes this difficult for a startup).

data.title: Landscape Support for WP8
data.body:
We need to implement landscape left/right (also upside down portrait) support for Windows Phone 8.

In XNA this was done for the user automatically.  An oriented render target was provided for rendering and all input was rotated.

In Windows 8 Store apps it is also done automatically for you by default as well.  You get an oriented render target and input is rotated.  The docs do however provide some additional insight when using automatic rotation:

> "It performs a redundant full screen copy operation."
> http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/jj262112.aspx

So this is telling us automatic works, but it is costing us some fillrate doing a copy.

This means that even on WinRT there is some savings to not using automatic rotation.  They recommend what has been mentioned before... append the rotation to your projection matrix.  Here is a good example of implementing this for WP8:

http://www.catalinzima.com/2012/12/handling-orientation-in-a-windows-phone-8-game/

Where does this leave MonoGame?  I think we have to do two things:

1 - Provide the automatic method using an offscreen render target with an efficient copy.

This would not only be a feature for WP8, but we can possibly use it to also support scaling of the backbuffer on Android as well.

2 - Add support for matrix level rotation.

We can add some flag in GraphicsDevice or GraphicsDeviceManager that hints to the system that we want to opt-out of automatic rotation.  We would expose something like GraphicsDevice.ScreenRotationMatrix.  Under the hood stock Effects and SpriteBatch would use this automatically...  so most games won't care.  If you are using a custom effect you would have to add this explicitly into your projection.

These two features should cover us no matter the platform moving forward with minimal pain to end users.

data.title: AccessViolationException when closing WindowsGL project.
data.body:
I confront with  AccessViolationException which randomly(not always) emitted when I closes Game(Its annoying !). 

The problem is in this thing

OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.IsProgram

disassembly is

00000000  push        ebp 
00000001  mov         ebp,esp 
00000003  sub         esp,8 
00000006  mov         dword ptr [ebp-4],ecx 
00000009  cmp         dword ptr ds:[05688814h],0 //random address
00000010  je          00000017  //random address
00000012  call        5F846C92 //random address
00000017  mov         ecx,dword ptr ds:[03D5A4D0h] //random address
0000001d  mov         edx,dword ptr [ebp-4] 
00000020  mov         eax,dword ptr [ecx+0Ch] 
00000023  mov         ecx,dword ptr [ecx+4] 
00000026  call        eax 
00000028  mov         dword ptr [ebp-8],eax 
0000002b  movzx       eax,byte ptr [ebp-8] 
0000002f  mov         esp,ebp 
00000031  pop         ebp 
00000032  ret 

This strange problem emitted only if I manually create and draw geometry.

data.title: Fix render mode in SpriteBatch. 2D render is now working.
data.body: This PR fix the 2D render mode in PSMobile.

data.title: Fix IsMouseVisible [WinDX] + [WinGL/Linux]. New IsBorderless [WinDX]
data.body:
This PR includes the following changes:
- Fix to IsMouseVisible on WinDX platform
- Change to IsMouseVisible on WinGL/Linux platform (can someone test on linux please)
- New feature: IsBorderless, currently only implemented on WinDX. (ill look for other platform implementations later on. http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/406437)
- Change to the Assembly description for WinDX (from OpenGL to DirectX)

I'm still very new to git/github. I made a similar PR over at the now old WinDX repo: https://github.com/SickheadGames/MonoGame/pull/12 but didn't know how to move the PR over to this repo, so I made a new PR and changed some more things.

The reason why I changed IsMouseVisible is because the current implementation seemed a bit hackish and didn't work well.

Someone please test the IsMouseVisible property on linux.

Please give me feedback, thanks :)

data.title: MGCB Improvements
data.body:
Added some fixes to the MonoGame Content Builder tool so it can be a better host for developing and testing improvements to the content pipeline.
- MGCB now links against MonoGame and not MS XNA.
- Added some initial exception and error handling which prints errors to the console.
- Removed the MSBuild Tasks from the pipeline project (didn't delete the files yet).
- Fixed some random pipeline bugs.

With these changes everyone should be able to work out of the MGCB solution for doing content pipeline development work.

data.title: Add Boolean Support to EffectParameter
data.body: Fix the EffectParameter and ConstantBuffer code to support Boolean parameters.  We should also make sure integer parameters are working correctly.

data.title: Where is MGFX ?
data.body: Hello. Im trying compile project with custom effect. I placed all xnb files to correct directory but when Im start its emit Exception with "The MGFX file is corrupt!". After lurking monogame more deeply i found these effects must be compiled with 2MGFX. Where can I find it ? It isnt in ProgramFiles(x86)/MonoGame. Sorry of posting this here, at codeplex nobody answer to my questions.

data.title: First working .xnb texture writtten.
data.body:
Contents of this PR allow for the content builder to import, process, and serialize a 32 bit ARGB or 24 bit RGB texture that works in a MonoGame project. First step in issue https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1214.

Let me know if there are any concerns.
